fields.name: Penguin Random House
fields.description: Penguin Random House is the international home to nearly 250 editorially and creatively independent publishing imprints.

fields.name: HarperCollins
fields.description: HarperCollins Publishers is one of the world's largest publishing companies.

fields.name: Tor Books
fields.description: Tor Books is a major publisher of science fiction and fantasy.

fields.biography: Ursula Kroeber Le Guin was an American author best known for her works of speculative fiction, including science fiction and fantasy. She was widely recognized as a master of the craft, writing both poetry and prose.
Neil Richard MacKinnon Gaiman is an English author of short fiction, novels, comic books, graphic novels, nonfiction, audio theatre, and films.
Sir Terence David John Pratchett was an English humorist, satirist, and author of fantasy novels, especially comedic works. He was best known for his Discworld series of 41 novels.

Dame Agatha Mary Clarissa Christie was an English writer known for her 66 detective novels and 14 short story collections, particularly those revolving around fictional detectives Hercule Poirot and Miss Marple.

fields.title: A Wizard of Earthsea
fields.summary:
A young boy named Ged discovers he has great magical power and enters a school of wizardry on the island of Roke.

In his pride and arrogance, he attempts a dangerous spell that releases a terrible shadow creature into the world â€” a nameless thing that hunts him across land and sea.

Driven by fear, Ged flees from island to island, but the shadow follows relentlessly. Only when he turns to face it does he begin to understand its true nature.

The first book in the Earthsea cycle, this is a story about the cost of power, the importance of balance, and the journey toward self-knowledge.

fields.title: Good Omens
fields.summary: The world is going to end next Saturday, and an angel and a demon who have grown rather fond of Earth team up to prevent the apocalypse.

fields.title: The Left Hand of Darkness
fields.summary: A lone human ambassador is sent to the icy planet of Gethen, whose inhabitants can change their gender. A story of betrayal and politics on an alien world.

fields.title: Murder on the Orient Express
fields.summary: After a snowstorm stops the Orient Express in its tracks, a passenger is found murdered. Detective Hercule Poirot must identify the killer among the stranded passengers.

fields.title: American Gods
fields.summary: A recently released convict named Shadow Moon discovers that the gods of ancient mythology are alive and living in America, preparing for an epic battle.
